summary:
Profile

•	He is all-round, with strong capacities in 1) Proposal writing; 2) (Interim) management (of projects, programs, and grants); and 3) Project evaluation.
•	A team-player who goes the extra mile, he uses a good sense of humour to his advantage. He is analytical and structured, also under pressure, and communicates well in English and French. 
•	He worked in 25 developing nations including fragile states (D.R. of Congo, Rwanda, Burundi, Chad, Haiti), specializing in in sub-Saharan Africa where he worked & lived for 9 years. 
•	He is used to working for different types of organizations, including Non-Governmental Organizations (e.g., SNV, ICCO, Oxfam Novib, Hivos, Agriterra), the Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs (DGIS, Embassies), the United Nations (UNDP, UNHCR), Associations (the Netherlands Red Cross), and universities (Florida, Tilburg). 


Key qualifications:

a. Grant proposal writing: He compiles often winning proposals for donors such as the EC, ECHO, Sida, African Development Bank, the Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs (DGIS, MFS, and the FLOW-, Civil Society-, PDW-, and SRHR-Fund), USAID, UNDP, UNICEF, IKEA Foundation, SHO, Red Cross etc. 

b. (Interim) project, program and grant management: For 13 years, he (interim) coordinated projects and programs with up-to 120 staff and budgets of €6 million per year. He acted as country director twice (e.g. for Netherlands Red Cross). He also conducts EC Grant management. 

c. Project and program evaluation: For accountability and learning purposes, he uses varied quantitative and qualitative methods to evaluate NGOs, cooperatives and federations. For example, he evaluated all humanitarian programs of the Netherlands Red Cross in 16 Countries.

Thematic expertise: 
o	Inclusive socio-economic development, youth employability, governance, gender-equality. 
o	Organizational strengthening of cooperatives. 
o	Agricultural and value chain development, climate change and adaptation. 
o	Humanitarian assistance, acute, protracted. 
o	Software skills including Google Docs, Microsoft Office, Geographical Information Systems.

Contact/
Bob Hesterman Consult

•	Address: Weteringschans 181/2h, 1017 XE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
•	Telephone: ++31 6 11115191
•	Mail: bob.hesterman@yahoo.com
•	LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/bob-hesterman
•	Chamber of Commerce number: 64525813
